segments.content: This is another great React week.

segments.content: Vercel has unveiled new super-interesting caching APIs for Next.js, and the React Native ecosystem is on fire!

segments.content: Last week, the community gathered at the Next.js conference. This recap is a nice overview of the highlights, including:
segments.sourceMdx: Last week, the community gathered at the Next.js conference. This recap is a nice overview of the highlights, including:

segments.content:
* Next.js 15 stable
* Turbopack Dev stable
* Simpler caching, reduced complexity
* Self-hosting improvements and templates
segments.sourceMdx:
- Next.js 15 stable
- Turbopack Dev stable
- Simpler caching, reduced complexity
- Self-hosting improvements and templates

segments.content: The sister blog post [Our Journey with Caching](https://nextjs.org/blog/our-journey-with-caching) is particularly interesting, introducing new experimental caching semantics and APIs such as `use cache`, `cacheTag`, and `cacheLife`. Itâ€™s a more flexible system, and super cool that you donâ€™t even need to provide a cache key.
segments.sourceMdx: The sister blog post [Our Journey with Caching](https://nextjs.org/blog/our-journey-with-caching) is particularly interesting, introducing new experimental caching semantics and APIs such as `use cache`, `cacheTag`, and `cacheLife`. Itâ€™s a more flexible system, and super cool that you donâ€™t even need to provide a cache key.

* ğŸ’¸ [Product for Engineers - A/B testing mistakes I learned the hard way](https://dub.sh/twir-oct30)
* ğŸ“– [Using shadcn/ui with Next.js 15 and React 19](https://ui.shadcn.com/docs/react-19): Explains how to handle peer deps, gives status of React 19 support of underlying libs.
* ğŸ“£ [Netlify Joins OpenNext](https://www.netlify.com/blog/netlify-joins-opennext/): They moved their adapter to the OpenNext org and started collaborating with Cloudclare and SST to make Next.js more portable.
* ğŸ—“ï¸Â [React Day Berlin](https://reactday.berlin/?utm_source=Newsletter\&utm_medium=thisweekinreact) - ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ªÂ Berlin - 13 & 16 December - [Free remote tickets are available now, click here !](https://gitnation.com/badges/react-day-berlin-2024/sara_vieira?from=This+Week+In+React)
* ğŸ“œ [Live Streaming with React â€” More Rust in the JavaScript Ecosystem](https://blog.swmansion.com/live-streaming-with-react-more-rust-in-the-javascript-ecosystem-f83a0371e16c): This innovative project uses a custom React renderer to control a media server doing live video mixing. The article explains their implementation decisions.
* ğŸ“œ [Conditional React hooks pattern](https://robinmalfait.com/blog/conditional-react-hooks-pattern): Maintainer of Headless UI shares trick he uses in the library, passing `enabled` as first parameter to hooks.
* ğŸ“œ [HTML Form Validation is heavily underused](https://expressionstatement.com/html-form-validation-is-heavily-underused): Creates a convenient React abstraction on top of `input.setCustomValidity`.
* ğŸ“œ [Using Shadcn UI without a Tailwind Config File](https://www.luisball.com/blog/shadcn-ui-with-tailwind-v4): Use Tailwind v4 (alpha) with shadcn/ui in a Next.js 15 app. Unfortunately youâ€™ll have to copy/paste the components/dependencies manually until the CLI gets updated.
* ğŸ“œ [Add an RSS Feed to a Next.js Blog](https://didoesdigital.com/blog/nextjs-blog-09-rss/): Use a static route returning XML. Note I beg you to add an RSS feed, otherwise I have to pay Inoreader 0.20â‚¬/month to track your blog through selectors ğŸ˜….
* ğŸ“œ [How to roll your own auth in JavaScript & TypeScript](https://www.robinwieruch.de/how-to-roll-your-own-auth/): Step-by-step guide to implement auth in Next.js 15.
* ğŸ“œ [useContextSelector: Speeding Up React Apps With Large Context](https://marmelab.com/blog/2024/10/16/usecontextselector-a-faster-usecontext-for-react.html)
* ğŸ“œ [When to use redirect() vs. router.push() in Next.js](https://darios.blog/posts/redirect-vs-router-push-in-nextjs)
* ğŸ“œ [How To Set Up Next.js 15 For Production In 2024](https://janhesters.com/blog/how-to-set-up-nextjs-15-for-production-in-2024)
* ğŸ“¦ [Headless UI 2.2 - React 19 support](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/headlessui/releases/tag/%40headlessui%2Freact%40v2.2.0)
* ğŸ“¦ [MDX 3.1](https://github.com/mdx-js/mdx/releases/tag/3.1.0)
* ğŸ“¦ [Medusa 2.0 - Next.js and Remix starters](https://medusajs.com/starters/): This open source alternative to Shopify launched new major version, including various React-based e-commerce storefront starters.
* ğŸ¥ [Alem Tuzlak - When are React Server Components finally coming to React Router!?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JF9eS2bOAsM)
* ğŸ¥ [UI Engineering - Why "Stale Closure" Misleads React Devs](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7yw_D3h4xSo)

segments.content: Blacksmith runs your GitHub Actions substantially faster by running them on modern gaming CPUs. Integrating Blacksmith is a one-line code change. 100+ companies like Ashby, GitBook, Superblocks, and Slope use Blacksmith to help developers merge code faster.

segments.content: ## ğŸ“± React-Native
segments.sourceMdx: ## ğŸ“± React-Native {#react-native}

segments.content: [![New Architecture by default, DevTools, and more](/emails/issues/207/newarch.jpg)](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/10/23/release-0.76-new-architecture)
segments.sourceMdx: [![New Architecture by default, DevTools, and more](/emails/issues/207/newarch.jpg)](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/10/23/release-0.76-new-architecture)

segments.content: [**React Native 0.76 - New Architecture by default, DevTools, and more**](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/10/23/release-0.76-new-architecture)
segments.sourceMdx: [**React Native 0.76 \- New Architecture by default, DevTools, and more**](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/10/23/release-0.76-new-architecture)

segments.content: React Native 0.76 is out with major updates! The New Architecture is now enabled by default, there's a new React Native DevTools for improved debugging, and CSS support for `boxShadow` and `filter` for enhanced UI effects (available only with the new architecture). Be aware of some breaking changes: minimum SDK requirements have been raised to iOS 15.1 and Android SDK 24 (Android 7). Time to upgrade and check it out!
segments.sourceMdx: React Native 0.76 is out with major updates\! The New Architecture is now enabled by default, there's a new React Native DevTools for improved debugging, and CSS support for `boxShadow` and `filter` for enhanced UI effects (available only with the new architecture). Be aware of some breaking changes: minimum SDK requirements have been raised to iOS 15.1 and Android SDK 24 (Android 7). Time to upgrade and check it out\!

segments.content: v0.76 is cool, but whatâ€™s even better is that the [New Architecture is here](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/10/23/the-new-architecture-is-here) and officially declared ready to be used in production! This is a multi-year effort and a huge milestone for the React Native ecosystem! At this point, you probably already heard about JSI, Fabric, Turbomodules, synchronous low-overhead bridgeless communication, interop mode, and more. Itâ€™s not just about performance, but also solving important UX/DX problems such as being able to measure views synchronously to position a tooltip, or having `useLayoutEffect` work like on the web. What excites me most is also probably the most underrated: React Native can finally use React 18+ concurrent features, notably transitions, Suspense, and whatâ€™s coming next.
segments.sourceMdx: v0.76 is cool, but whatâ€™s even better is that the [New Architecture is here](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/10/23/the-new-architecture-is-here) and officially declared ready to be used in production\! This is a multi-year effort and a huge milestone for the React Native ecosystem\! At this point, you probably already heard about JSI, Fabric, Turbomodules, synchronous low-overhead bridgeless communication, interop mode, and more. Itâ€™s not just about performance, but also solving important UX/DX problems such as being able to measure views synchronously to position a tooltip, or having `useLayoutEffect` work like on the web. What excites me most is also probably the most underrated: React Native can finally use React 18+ concurrent features, notably transitions, Suspense, and whatâ€™s coming next.

segments.content:
* ğŸ’¸ [Expo Starter Kit - The Swiss Army Knife of Mobile App Building](https://expostarter.com?utm_source=this-week-in-react\&utm_medium=newsletter\&utm_campaign=this-week-in-react-10-30-2024)
* ğŸ“£ [React Native Announcement - Handling Android 15's edge-to-edge enforcement](https://github.com/react-native-community/discussions-and-proposals/discussions/827): Android 15 changes how content is displayed on screen. SafeAreaView is going to be deprecated. The new library [react-native-edge-to-edge](https://github.com/zoontek/react-native-edge-to-edge) is an alternative to fully embrace edge-to-edge rendering. Note it just reached 1.0 and is supported by Expo.
* ğŸ“£ [Flipper repository is being archived](https://fbflipper.com/blog/2024/10/24/changes-to-oss-flipper/)
* ğŸ—“ï¸Â [RNLConf](https://www.reactnativelondon.co.uk/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§Â London - 14 & 15 November - Last chance to grab a ticket ! Donâ€™t forget your discount with code â€œTWIRâ€.
* ğŸ“œ [React Native, and â€œthe native feelâ€](https://mozzius.dev/post/3l777nhz4h32w): Bluesky dev explains how they made their Expo app feel native. Itâ€™s the sum of many little details, such as hairlineWidth, bottom sheets, animations, navigation.
* ğŸ“œ [Animated Spiral with React Native Skia](https://reactiive.io/articles/animated-spiral): Reactiive just relaunched his blog with greatly interactive animated Skia playgrounds, very satisfying to look at!
* ğŸ“œ [Enhance App Performance and Business Growth With Real User Monitoring (RUM)](https://www.callstack.com/blog/enhance-app-performance-and-business-with-real-user-monitoring-rum)

SafeAreaView is going to be deprecated. The new library [react-native-edge-to-edge](https://github.com/zoontek/react-native-edge-to-edge) is an alternative to fully embrace edge-to-edge rendering. Note it just reached 1.0 and is supported by Expo.
